communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communications concerning the City of Dallas Public Library's Enhanced Library Card program between employees of the City of Dallas and any local, state or federal law enforcement agencies, including but not limited to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Border Patrol. This request should not be understood to be seeking personally identifiable information of ID holders. The date range for this request is from Oct. 1, 2024, to the present.

Please include any relevant emails, memos, reports, or other forms of communication that pertain to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cory Dawson

title: George W. Bush Library: Lou Pearlman Documents

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents related to boy band empresario Lou Pearlman. A recent Netflix special included the assertion that in the immediate aftermath of 9/11, Pearlman was able to directly call President Bush in order to clear Pearlman's private plane to fly. 



News coverage of the Netflix special described this Pearlman/Bush connection as: 

"However, his (Pearlman's) connections were so significant that he called President George W. Bush to request special permission to allow the members of Natural to fly. Not only did President Bush grant special permission, but he also sent special planes to pick them up in New York. Lou Pearlman was so powerful that he could bypass strict national laws for his personal benefit. Pearlman quite literally defied the attacks on September 11, 2001—not even something as severe as that could stand in his way."

Here's a link to news coverage of the Netflix special:

https://screenrant.com/netflix-dirty-pop-boy-band-scam-documentary-shocking-reveals/

If any such documents exist, this is a request for:

Any correspondence between Lou Pearlman and President Bush 
Any correspondence from Governor Jeb Bush that mentions Pearlman 
Any record of a phone call between Pearlman and Bush in the aftermath of 9/11
Any record of President Bush's effort to assist Pearlman's flight
Any photographs of Pearlman and President Bush or Laura Bush together 

Thank you for the Bush library's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request until it reaches resolution.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Obama Library: NSC Correspondence Related to May 2013 "Drone Playbook" Fact Sheet

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Library: NSC Correspondence Related to May 2013 "Drone Playbook" Fact Sheet
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, email threads, or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the drafting of the May 2013 publication on the Whitehouse.gov website of a "drone playbook fact sheet." The formal name of this document is: "U.S. Policy Standards and Procedures for the Use of Force in Counterterrorism Operations Outside of the United States and Areas of Active Hostilities." This document was a carefully crafted public statement regarding drone use by the Obama administration. Please be sure to include a search of pre-publication emails that transmitted all fact sheet drafts (including as attachments) before it was published. 

An archived version of this document is located at: https://web.archive.org/web/20130525000828/https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/uploads/2013.05.23_fact_sheet_on_ppg.pdf
News media coverage of controversies surrounding the release of this playbook can be easily found online: https://www.politico.eu/article/obama-to-release-drone-playbook/

In order to limit the scope of this request, please limit the time range for relevant documents from January 20th 2009 until the date in May 2013 when the fact sheet was published. In order to expedite this request, documents related to the 2013 to 2016 battle to release the "Presidential Policy Guidance (PPG)" memo need NOT be part of this request. 

Thank you for the Obama Presidential Library's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you towards resolving this request

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware
